value.name: Donald Trump ordered to pay $354 million in New York real estate fraud lawsuit
value.description: "In order to borrow more and at lower rates, defendants submitted blatantly false financial data to the accountants, resulting in fraudulent financial statements," Engoron said in a 92-page ruling.Start the day smarter.

video.name: Judges orders Donald Trump to pay over $300 million in damages in real estate fraud case

value.name: Give up street lanes in L.A. for bikes and buses? Measure HLA is on the ballot
value.description: Councilmember Traci Park worries LA will ‘end up with a system of road diets to nowhere just in time for the Olympics.’

value.name: Trump Loses It Over $355 Million Judgment In Civil Fraud Trial
value.description: "A crooked New York state judge... has just fined me $355 Million based on nothing other than having built a GREAT COMPANY," Trump wrote on Truth Social.

value.name: Trump ‘perfected the art of the steal’, New York attorney general says after $350m ruling – live
value.description: Letitia James says judgment of more than $350m shows Trump ‘engaged in incredible financial fraud to enrich himself’ – follow the latest

value.name: Transcript: Tories reel from by-election blows
value.description: Lucy Fisher talks to George Parker, Rafe Uddin, elections guru Professor Sir John Curtice and the FT’s foreign editor Alec Russell

value.name: Yousaf to campaign in Scottish Tory leader’s seat
value.description: First Minister Humza Yousaf will campaign in the Moray seat of Scottish Tory leader Douglas Ross as he pushes to make Scotland “Tory-free” after the next election. The SNP has set its sights on Mr Ross’ party, with Labour riding high in the polls ahead of an election expected this year.

value.name: Nigel Farage declares: Tory members want ME as their leader, not Rishi Sunak
value.description: Nigel Farage says grassroots Conservatives would prefer him to lead the party instead of Rishi Sunak in the wake of two crushing by-election drubbings.

value.name: ‘Come together’ Sunak tells Conservatives after twin by-election blow
value.description: Rishi Sunak has called on British conservatives to ‘come together’, after a bruising set of by-election defeats in Wellingborough and Kingswood.

value.name: Reform leader rejects an election pact with Conservatives
value.description: Richard Tice rules out a collaboration with Rishi Sunak as Tories fear the general election becoming a ‘slow-moving car crash’

value.name: ‘It’s a sinking ship’: Grassroots Tories fear general election wipeout
value.description: Grassroots Tories fear a general election wipeout if Rishi Sunak cannot convince Conservative supporters to turn out and vote after the party suffered a double by-election defeat. Councillors told i the by-election results in Wellingborough and Kingswood ...

value.name: Labour’s by-election victories are historic, but ultimately shallow
value.description: Fortunately for the party, the two seats duly delivered. Kingswood was always likely to deliver a Labour victory – and the seat is one of those that, if the next general election were being held on the current parliamentary boundaries,

value.name: What Labour’s by-election wins mean for the general election
value.description: The 37.6 per cent drop in its vote in Wellingborough is the biggest decline the Conservative Party has ever suffered in a by-election it was defending. This brought us all back to reality. After a diverting couple of weeks needling Sir Keir Starmer about his failure to wipe out antisemitism within the party or to deal with Labour’s conspiracy theorist candidate in Rochdale as swiftly as he should have,

value.name: By-elections: Tory gloom deepens after double poll blow
value.description: Tory candidate Helen Harrison had a night to forget So, another two whopping by-election victories for Labour. What is most striking about the results in Wellingborough and Kingwood is that they feel almost unsurprising,

value.name: Nigel Farage says he 'might' return to lead Reform UK after by-election results
value.description: Nigel Farage has said he “might” make a return to frontline politics to lead Reform UK after the party’s record by-election results. The Conservatives suffered a double defeat in the Kingswood and Wellingborough votes, with Labour over turning large Tory majorities in the seats.

value.name: These by-election results could be consequential and dramatic - here's why
value.description: As the choice in the general election looms, these two by-elections were more hammerings which confirmed Labour's momentum - and made for a terrible night for Rishi Sunak and the Conservatives.

value.name: When is the next general election? The dates Rishi Sunak is considering
value.description: The Prime Minister has hinted at an autumn poll but could call one as early as May. The Telegraph examines his options

value.name: Pollster offers by-election verdict as Reform UK surges – and it's bad news for everyone
value.description: The Tories have taken a kicking, Labour have two new MPs and Reform are flying high - but Professor Sir John Curtice warns that the real losers were everyone.

value.name: By-election results since 2019 as Labour takes two more seats from Tories
value.description: The latest by-elections mean the Conservatives have suffered more by-election defeats than in any single Parliament since the Second World War

value.name: The Tories ‘must adapt’ if they want General Election hope after two by-election drubbings
value.description: RISHI Sunak has been urged to “change course” by his Tory MPs to give them hope for the General Election. The warning to the PM came after two by-election drubbings. Both Wellingborough, in Northants, and Kingswood, Gloucs, were lost to Labour — with ...

value.name: Automatic voter registration in Wales moves a step closer
value.description: Mick Antoniw said the Elections and Elected Bodies bill is an important step ... Mr Antoniw – who is counsel general, the Welsh Government’s chief legal adviser – stressed the importance of protecting vulnerable voters through anonymous registration.

value.name: Read: Judge’s $354 million civil fraud decision against Trump
value.description: A New York judge on Friday afternoon ordered former President Trump to pay more than $350 million in penalties as part of the civil fraud case focused on the Trump family’s business empire.

value.name: Letters: The Conservatives are being punished for treating their core voters with contempt
value.description: SIR – Rishi Sunak is imploring voters not to put Labour in power by switching to Reform UK, following the Conservatives’ Kingswood and Wellingborough by-election losses (report, telegraph.co.uk, February 16).

value.name: Republican quits Senate bid just days after announcement after failing to get Trump endorsement
value.description: Republican quits Senate bid just days after announcement after failing to get Trump endorsement - Matt Rosendale dropped out once the former president endorsed his would-be primary opponent

video.name: Republican lawmaker claims as a vet he is ‘qualified’ to ban abortion

value.name: Court overturns Senegalese presidential election delay
value.description: Senegal will hold its next presidential election as soon as possible following the overturning of incumbent Macky Sall's postponement of the vote.

value.name: Are There Any Persuadable Voters Left?
value.description: But that’s not universal. Murray of Monmouth said that there were still some voters whose identities were not closely tied to their politics — and they might be up for grabs. “Those are the persuadable voters,” he said, “that don’t buy into kind of these doomsday scenarios that both parties are putting out if the other party wins.”

value.name: The gathering storm at your dinner table
value.description: FAMILY FEUD — New research suggests a fascinating trend with implications for politics — and family dinners: Daughters from conservative families are voting for Democrats at levels much higher than sons.

value.name: Shareholders Led by Yi Zhang Announce Successful Results of Removal of Directors and Election of New Directors of YS Biopharma Co., Ltd.
value.description: Yi Zhang and shareholders representing over 59.2% of the outstanding shares of YS Biopharma Co., Ltd. (the "Company" or "YS") (NASDAQ: YS) (the "Convening Shareholders") today announced the successful approval of all resolutions at the YS Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders ("EGM") held today.

value.name: Divided Michigan Republicans plan dueling meetings to choose presidential nominee
value.description: Warring factions within the Michigan Republican Party are planning to hold separate meetings next month to choose the party's presidential nominee, the latest sign of the turmoil gripping the party in the key battleground state.

value.name: Live updates: Trump ordered to pay over $350M after fraud trial; Fani Willis hearing adjourns
value.description: Updates and news coverage on what's at stake in Trump's misconduct allegations against DA Fani Willis, who is prosecuting the the Georgia election interference case.

value.name: Maine voting FAQ
value.description: Another way to register to vote is to download and print a Maine voter registration application from the Secretary of State’s website or contact your town clerk to have a voter registration card mailed to you. You can hand deliver or mail the completed voter registration application or card to your town office or city hall.

value.name: Trump's civil fraud verdict appeal may hinge on 'no victims' defense
value.description: Donald Trump's planned appeal of a $355 million judgment against him in his civil fraud case may focus on the former president's contention that there were no actual victims from his conduct at issue in the case,

value.name: Reform leader rejects an election pact with Conservatives
value.description: Richard Tice rules out a collaboration with Rishi Sunak as Tories fear the general election becoming a ‘slow-moving car crash’

value.name: Rishi Sunak faces mutinous Tory party after by-election losses
value.description: Danny Kruger and Miriam Cates, the co-leaders of the New Conservatives faction of right-wing Tory MPs, also issued a damning statement accusing Sunak of presiding over “consensus politics” that centred on “high taxes, low security, managed decline”.

value.description: The 37.6 per cent drop in its vote in Wellingborough is the biggest decline the Conservative Party has ever suffered in a by-election it was defending. This brought us all back to reality. After a diverting couple of weeks needling Sir Keir Starmer about his failure to wipe out antisemitism within the party or to deal with Labour’s conspiracy theorist candidate in Rochdale as swiftly as he should have,

value.name: Wellingborough and Kingswood by-elections: Job not done despite huge wins, says Starmer
value.description: The party came third in both by-elections, picking up 13% of the vote in Wellingborough and 10.4% in Kingswood. Labour secured a majority of 2,501 over Tory candidate Sam Bromiley in the South Gloucestershire seat of Kingswood, near Bristol.

value.name: A tempestuous day in multiple courts deepens Trump’s legal imbroglio
value.description: Trump’s lawyers made a final, beseeching plea to the Supreme Court to stop the clock in a federal trial over his attempt to overturn the 2020 election. Justices must now decide whether to take up one of the most profound cases in the body’s history.

value.name: Byelection results - live: Boost for Starmer after Rochdale ‘shambles’ as Labour clinches two major victories
value.description: Labour overturns two large majorities to take seats in Northamptonshire and South Gloucestershire on a bad night for the Conservative party

value.name: Why Abortion Matters In This Suddenly Competitive Blue-State Senate Race
value.description: Larry Hogan has managed to make his anti-abortion rights views irrelevant in Maryland. That’ll be a tough sell as he runs for Senate.

value.name: Nigel Farage says he and Tories such as Jacob Rees-Mogg 'will have to be in the same party at some point' as he urges right-wing unity - but only after the general election
value.description: The Brexit architect, the former leader of UKIP , predicted a coming together of right-wing politicians in the wake of two more by-election defeats for the Tories.

value.name: By-elections: Tory gloom deepens after double poll blow
value.description: And in Kingswood, near Bristol, they got a share of the vote greater than the gap between the victorious Labour candidate and the Tory runner-up. That is a double dose of the heebie-jeebies delivered in one day to nervous Tories.

value.name: Nigel Farage says he 'might' return to lead Reform UK after by-election results
value.description: Nigel Farage has said he “might” make a return to frontline politics to lead Reform UK after the party’s record by-election results. The Conservatives suffered a double defeat in the Kingswood and Wellingborough votes, with Labour over turning large Tory majorities in the seats.

value.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is facing a weekend of difficult questions after his governing Conservative policy lost two seats in parliament on Thursday.

value.name: Could Reform UK surge sink Tory election hopes?
value.description: Reform UK leader Richard Tice has said he wants to "smash" and "destroy" the Tory Party at the general election. He insisted Reform UK would never consider repeating the Brexit Party's 2019 deal with the Conservatives - which saw it withdraw candidates in 317 constituencies after then-Tory leader Boris Johnson committed to leaving the EU by 2020.

value.name: ‘A vote for Reform is a vote for Starmer’, says Sunak
value.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said the ‘actual choice’ at the general election is ‘between me and him’, referring to the Labour leader.

value.name: Kingswood by-election: Labour's Damien Egan overturns large Tory majority
value.description: Tory MP Jacob Rees-Mogg, whose North East Somerset constituency borders Kingswood, blamed the result on a low turnout and insisted Rishi Sunak's leadership is "solid" and "by-elections don't change that". However he added, his party "needs some fresh ideas".

value.name: Conservatives lose two by-elections after huge swings towards Labour
value.description: The twin blows will compound the Prime Minister's woes, coming the day after it was officially announced that the UK had entered a recession at the end of 2023, and mean the Conservatives have suffered more by-election defeats than in any single Parliament since the Second World War.

value.name: Conservatives’ by-election scorecard since 2019 general election
value.description: The Conservatives’ share of the vote slumped from 62% at the 2019 general election to just 25%, the largest drop recorded by the Tories at any by-election since 1945. The Conservatives have made one by-election gain during this parliament: Hartlepool in County Durham, which the party took from Labour on a swing of 16.0 percentage points.
